Ben Thanh Market
description:
Ben Thanh Market is located in the center of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, in District 1. It is one of the city's oldest remaining structures and an important symbol of the city.Ben Thanh Market is a famous destination for many domestic and foreign tourists from all over the world.

name: An Dong Market
description:
The bustling and vibrant An Dong Market is an ideal destination for tourists from all over to visit for shopping and have the opportunity to understand more about local culture.If you don't know where to go in Saigon, stop by An Dong market to discover interesting things.

name: Binh Tay Market
description:
Binh Tay Market is an extremely famous wholesale market in Ho Chi Minh City.This is a place to visit and shop with rich historical and cultural values ​​typical of Saigon business people for many generations.

name: Tan Dinh Market
description:
As one of the oldest markets in Saigon - Tan Dinh must have been a very familiar place to the people of the city named after Uncle Ho.Tan Dinh Market was built in 1926 and is a historical market of Ho Chi Minh City. It has long been a destination for many locals, young people and foreign tourists who want to learn about Vietnamese culture.
https://www.traveloka.com/vi-vn/explore/destination/du-lich-cho-tan-dinh-acc/253819

name: Ba Chieu Market
description:
Ba Chieu Market is not only one of the oldest markets in Ho Chi Minh City but also the busiest shopping destination in Binh Thanh District.The bustling atmosphere and traditional shopping culture make the market a familiar destination for many people.
https://www.xanhsm.com/news/cho-ba-chieu

name: Tan Binh Market
description:
Established in 1960, Tan Binh market has become one of the oldest and largest wholesale clothing markets in Saigon.This place is not only a familiar destination for small businesses but also attracts thousands of visitors and shoppers every day.
https://www.xanhsm.com/news/cho-tan-binh

name: Xom Chieu Market
description:
Xom Chieu Market (also known as 200 market) is a long-standing market with a diverse culinary space, from traditional delicacies to trendy snacks.This place is not only a shopping and dining destination but also a place to preserve culture, reflecting the vibrant pace of life typical of Saigon.
https://www.xanhsm.com/news/cho-xom-chieu-quan-4

name: Thu Duc Market
description:
Thu Duc Market, also known as Thu Duc agricultural wholesale market, is one of the largest markets in the city.Ho Chi Minh.With a bustling atmosphere and 24/24 operations, this is an ideal destination for those who want to shop, trade or experience the characteristics of a wholesale market.
https://www.xanhsm.com/news/cho-thu-duc

name: Ho Chi Minh City Children's House
description:
Over the past 50 years, Ho Chi Minh City Children's House has become a familiar, close and dear address for many generations of children in the City.Not only is it a place to have fun, study, and practice skills, this place is also a cradle that nurtures dreams, a spiritual fulcrum, and a "second home" for many generations of children to grow up and shine.
https://baotintuc.vn/van-hoa/nha-thieu-nhi-tp-ho-chi-minh-noi-chap-canh-uoc-mo-cua-bao-the-he-20250529101119676.htm

name: Ho Chi Minh City People's Court
description:
The People's Court of Ho Chi Minh City (referred to as Ho Chi Minh City Court) was established in September 1976. The court was born after the historic event of April 30, 1975, when the government of North Vietnam took over the entire court system in South Vietnam.After that, the new government established the Ho Chi Minh City Court.
https://logiclaw.vn/gioi-thieu-ve-toa-an-nhan-dan-thanh-pho-ho-chi-minh/

name: Ho Chi Minh City Pasteur Institute
description:
Ho Chi Minh City Pasteur Institute is a leading medical organization in Vietnam, specializing in research, diagnosis and disease prevention.The institute was founded in 1891 with the original name Pasteur Institute Saigon, and is the leading institute in preventive medicine and immunity for the southern region.The Institute provides services such as vaccination, testing and scientific research, and also has the function of providing professional guidance to the southern provinces.
https://vnexpress.net/kien-truc-phap-xua-va-ngoi-mo-co-o-vien-pasteur-tp-hcm-4922642.html

name: Ho Chi Minh City Eye Hospital
description:
Ho Chi Minh City Eye Hospital (also known as Dien Bien Phu Eye Hospital) is a class I specialized hospital, operating since 1978 and is the leading ophthalmology center in the Southern region.The hospital specializes in examining and treating eye diseases for people, with a full range of specialized departments and a team of highly trained medical staff.
https://tuoitre.vn/toan-canh-benh-vien-mat-tp-hcm-noi-duoc-de-xuat-xep-hang-di-tich-kien-truc-nghe-thuat-20230908130325956.htm

name: Ho Chi Minh City Heart Institute
description:
Ho Chi Minh City Heart Institute is a leading cardiovascular hospital in Vietnam, specializing in the prevention, diagnosis, treatment and rehabilitation of cardiovascular diseases.The institute was established in 1992, has a team of experienced doctors, modern facilities and is one of the two largest cardiovascular centers in Southeast Asia.The institute performs many congenital heart and coronary surgeries with high success rates, including newborn cases.
https://cmi-vietnam.com/en/the-heart-institute/#:~:text=A%20symbol%20of%20a%20unique,responsible%20for%20its%20financial%20management.

name: An Binh Hospital
description: An Binh Hospital is a class I general hospital directly under the City Department of Health.HCM, located at 146 An Binh, District 5, City.HCM.The hospital has a large scale with 700 beds, providing a variety of services from basic medical examination and treatment to advanced techniques such as endoscopic surgery, joint replacement, laser lithotripsy, and is equipped with a modern medical equipment system.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Funeral Home (Le Quy Don)
description: Ho Chi Minh City Funeral Home (Le Quy Don) is an old funeral home located at No. 25, Le Quy Don Street, Ward 07, District 03, Ho Chi Minh City.This is a long-standing funeral facility, now replaced by a Taiwanese hot pot restaurant called Man Tang Guo Le Quy Don at 6B Le Quy Don, Vo Thi Sau Ward, District 3.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Funeral Home
description:
This is the main facility managed by the City and has a large scale.

name: Funeral home of Nguyen Tri Phuong Hospital
description:
Nguyen Tri Phuong Hospital Funeral Home, also known as Quang Dong Funeral Home, is located at 336 Tran Phu, Ward 7, District 5, Ho Chi Minh City, serving the needs of organizing funerals for the Vietnamese and Chinese communities.This location operates 24/7, provides full funeral services, has private parking and is highly appreciated by many people for its thoughtfulness and reasonable prices.
https://phucanvienlongan.vn/blogs/tin-tuc/tim-hieu-ve-nha-tang-le-benh-vien-nguyen-tri-phuong

name: From Fujian Road
description:
"Fujian Road" is the common name of architectural works, especially assembly halls, pagodas, and temples established by the Fujian community, often meaning places of worship and community activities.One of the most prominent examples is Nguyen Trai Hospital (Ho Chi Minh City), formerly known as Phuoc Kien Hospital, founded by the Chinese community in 1909.
https://tienphong.vn/can-canh-tu-duong-phuc-kien-lau-doi-trong-benh-vien-tai-tphcm-post1512201.tpo

name: Tam Son Assembly Hall
description:
Tam Son Assembly Hall is an important historical and architectural artistic relic in District 5, Ho Chi Minh City, built by the Fujian Chinese community in 1839. Initially a place to worship Kim Hue Thanh Mau (goddess of fertility), later Thien Hau Thanh Mau became the main deity worshiped.The Assembly Hall is a religious and cultural center, attracting many tourists to worship and pray, especially to pray.
https://vietnamdiscovery.com/ho-chi-minh-city/attractions/tam-son-hoi-quan-pagoda/

name: Quynh Phu Assembly Hall
description:
Quynh Phu Assembly Hall (also known as Ba Hai Nam Pagoda) is a national architectural and artistic monument in Ho Chi Minh City, a place of worship and cultural activities of the Hainan Chinese community.Built in 1824 and undergoing many restorations, the Assembly Hall is an architectural complex in the "four-hedron" style with unique decorative details, notably the art of bronze casting and wood carving.This Assembly Hall is also an attractive cultural tourist destination in the Cho Lon area.
https://vinpearl.com/vi/quynh-phu-hoi-quan-ninh-hoa-kham-pha-kien-truc-trung-hoa-doc-dao

name: Nghia Nhuan Assembly Hall
description:
Nghia Nhuan Assembly Hall (also known as Nghia Nhuan Communal House or Quan De Temple) is a national historical architectural and artistic relic with important cultural and spiritual significance for the Chaozhou Chinese community in Ho Chi Minh City.
https://quan5xinchao.vn/hoi-quan-nghia-nhuan/

name: Phuoc An Assembly Hall
description:
Phuoc An Assembly Hall (also known as Minh Huong Pagoda) is a long-standing religious facility of the Chinese community in Ho Chi Minh City, located at 184 Hong Bang Street, Ward 12, District 5. This Assembly Hall was recognized as a City-level Architectural Art Monument in 2009 and preserves many valuable ancient artifacts, typical of Chinese culture and beliefs.
https://quan5xinchao.vn/hoi-quan-phuoc-an/

name: Quang Trieu Assembly Hall
description:
Quang Trieu Assembly Hall (also known as Thien Hau Temple or Ba Cau Ong Lanh Pagoda) is a national architectural and artistic monument in Ho Chi Minh City, originally a place for community activities of Chinese people of Guangzhou and Trieu Khanh descent.
https://wowweekend.vn/ghe-tham-hoi-quan-quang-trieu-noi-chon-binh-yen-giua-sai-thanh-tap-nap.html

name: Long Thai Assembly Hall - Quan De Temple
description:
Long Thai Hoi Quan, commonly known as Ong Pagoda or Quan De Temple, is an important religious facility and architectural and artistic relic of the Chinese community (of Chaozhou origin) in Ho Chi Minh City.
https://www.trungtambaotonditichtphcm.com/Hoat-dong-trung-tam/10030/HOI-QU%C3%81N-NGHIA-AN-(MIEU-QUAN-DE).aspx

name: Tue Thanh Assembly Hall
description:
Tue Thanh Assembly Hall (also known as Thien Hau Temple or Ba Cho Lon Pagoda) is a long-standing folk religious architectural work of the Chinese people in Cho Lon, City.Ho Chi Minh.The Assembly Hall was built around the end of the 17th century, used as a meeting place, immigration management, and especially to worship Thien Hau Thanh Mau.This work has profound cultural and historical value with characteristic architecture, many precious antiques and is an important spiritual destination.
https://ttvhq5.com.vn/chua-ba-tue-thanh-hoi-quan/

name: Ha Chuong Assembly Hall
description:
Ha Chuong Assembly Hall is a national architectural and artistic relic located in District 5, City.Ho Chi Minh City, built around the early 19th century by Fujian Chinese people.This is an important building, outstanding with typical Chinese "four-sided" architecture, and is also the center of religious and community activities of the Chinese people.
https://ttvhq5.com.vn/hoi-quan-ha-chuong/

name: Nghia An Assembly Hall
description:
Nghia An Assembly Hall, also known as Ong Pagoda, is a national architectural and artistic relic in the city.Ho Chi Minh City, is the place to worship the god Quan Cong of the Chaozhou Chinese community.This work was built in the second half of the 19th century, standing out with its unique, sophisticated "mouth" architecture and bold Chinese culture.Today, the Assembly Hall is not only a spiritual cultural center but also an attractive tourist destination for tourists.
https://quan5xinchao.vn/hoi-quan-nghia-an/

name: Nhi Phu Assembly Hall
description:
Nhi Phu Assembly Hall is a national historical architectural and artistic relic located at 264 Hai Thuong Lan Ong Street, District 5, City.Ho Chi Minh.This is an ancient assembly hall of Fujian Chinese people, built around the 17th-18th centuries, initially as a place of worship and exchange for the compatriot community, now a famous tourist and religious destination and a recognized relic.
https://quan5xinchao.vn/hoi-quan-nhi-phu/

name: Quan Tan Assembly Hall
description:
Quan Tan Assembly Hall is a small assembly hall with relatively simple architecture, different from other assembly halls in the Saigon - Cho Lon area.A special feature is that the wooden pillars and diaphragms are not elaborately carved, except for the altar page and sash.
https://www.xanhsm.com/news/chua-ba-thien-hau

name: Sung Chinh Assembly Hall
description:
Sung Chinh Assembly Hall, also known as Four-Faced Pagoda, is a large charity assembly hall of the Hakka Chinese community (Hakka people) in District 8, Ho Chi Minh City, notable for its bold Chinese architecture and especially the temple worshiping the Four-Faced Buddha.This is a place that combines beliefs, community activities, cultural preservation and is also a spiritual tourism attraction.
https://vietnamnet.vn/tuong-phat-bon-mat-o-tp-hcm-hut-ngan-nguoi-toi-chiem-bai-dang-nuoc-do-cau-may-2219977.html

name: Le Chau Assembly Hall
description:
Le Chau Hoi Quan is an ancient goldsmith's ancestral church in Ho Chi Minh City, located at 586 Tran Hung Dao, District 5, and was recognized as a National Architectural and Artistic Monument in 1998. This place is a religious center and a meeting place for silversmiths, showing respect for the profession and preserving precious antiques.
https://mttqquan5.vn/hoi-quan-le-chau-nha-tho-to-tho-bac.html

name: Temple of Five Bas and Five Elements Tao Dan
description:
Tao Dan Ngu Hanh Temple is an ancient temple in Ho Chi Minh City, famous for its sacredness and was built to worship the five Ngu Hanh goddesses.This temple has traditional architecture, notably with an altar with 12 statues, including statues of the 5 Marble Mothers and other gods.In addition, the temple also preserves the ashes of the deceased and is highly respected by local people, who periodically organize offerings on the 16th day of the second lunar month.
https://nhadatlongan.net.vn/mieu-ba-ngu-hanh/

name: St. Joseph Seminary
description: "St. Joseph Major Seminary" can refer to two main organizations: St. Joseph Saigon Major Seminary (training priests for the Archdiocese of Ho Chi Minh City and neighboring dioceses) and Saint Joseph Xuan Loc Major Seminary (training priests for the dioceses of Ba Ria, Da Lat, Phan Thiet and Xuan Loc).Both are training places for priests of the Catholic Church in Vietnam.

name: Tomb of Truong Vinh Ky
description:
Truong Vinh Ky Mausoleum is a unique mausoleum of scientist Truong Vinh Ky at 520 Tran Hung Dao, District 5, Ho Chi Minh City, an architectural work combining East and West designed by him.This work is located in the family graveyard, which is the resting place of him, his wife and eldest son.The mausoleum stands out with its characteristic architecture, two Latin inscriptions on the door and exquisite decorative details.
https://www.historicvietnam.com/petrus-ky-mausoleum/

name: Church of Saint Jeanne d'Arc
description:
Saint Jeanne d'Arc Church, also known as Nga Sau Church, is a prominent religious building in District 5, Ho Chi Minh City, famous for its unique architecture and historical location.
https://www.xanhsm.com/news/nha-tho-thanh-jeanne-darc-quan-5

name: Cho Quan Church
description:
Cho Quan Church (official name is St. Anthony of Padua Church) is one of the oldest and most iconic Catholic churches in Ho Chi Minh City, notable for its ancient Gothic architecture and rich history.
https://thanhnien.vn/nha-tho-cho-quan-hon-300-nam-co-nhat-tphcm-duoc-xay-dung-8-lan-185250726124122702.htm

name: Tan Dinh Church
description:
Tan Dinh Church is a famous Catholic architectural work in District 3, City.Ho Chi Minh, built from 1870-1876.The church stands out with its characteristic pink color and combination of Gothic, Baroque and Roman architecture, attracting many visitors.The official name of the church is Sacred Heart of Jesus Church, located at 289 Hai Ba Trung.
https://vinpearl.com/vi/nha-tho-tan-dinh-sai-gon-diem-san-hinh-cuc-chat-cho-tin-do-yeu-mau-hong

name: Phu Hanh Church
description: Phu Hanh Church is a Catholic parish at 121 Phan Dang Luu, Ward 7, Phu Nhuan District, Ho Chi Minh City, established in 1975. The church has undergone many restorations and modifications and was solidly rebuilt in 1989. Currently, the church has a close-knit community of parishioners, divided into 5 neighborhoods, with diverse religious and pastoral activities.

name: Vinh Hoi Church
description: Vinh Hoi Church is an old and prominent Catholic church in District 4, Ho Chi Minh City, known for its unique architecture combining Asian and Western features.The church is located in a convenient location on the banks of Ben Nghe canal, easily seen from District 1.

name: Saigon Notre Dame Cathedral
description:
Saigon Notre Dame Cathedral is an outstanding historical architectural symbol of Ho Chi Minh City, located in the center of District 1 at 01 Paris Commune.This project was built in 1877 and completed in 1880 with classic French architecture and materials imported entirely from France.
https://www.xanhsm.com/news/nha-tho-duc-ba

name: An Binh Parish
description:
An Binh Parish, belonging to the Archdiocese of Saigon, located at 4 An Binh, Ward 5, District 5, was established in 1969 and took Saint Joseph the Worker as its Patron.The parish has different mass times on weekdays, and is currently led by Father Dominic Luu Nhuan Hien, and Father Joseph Tran Dang Quang is the Parish Deputy.
https://tgpsaigon.net/gioi-thieu-Giao-xu/an-binh-699

name: Cho Dui Parish - Huyen Si Church
description:
Cho Dui Parish - Huyen Sy Church is an ancient Catholic church, officially named Saint Philip the Apostle Church, located at 1 Ton That Tung, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City.This is one of the six oldest churches in Saigon, built in Gothic architectural style and inaugurated in 1910. The name "Huyen Sy" is familiar to local people to honor Mr. Le Phat Dat, who contributed to building the church.
https://mia.vn/cam-nang-du-lich/nha-tho-huyen-sy-19180

name: Mac Ty Nho Church
description:
Mac Ty Nho Church (also known as Mac Ty Nho Parish) is a prominent Catholic church located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, famous for its community activities and unique festival decorations.
https://muctim.tuoitre.vn/den-nha-tho-mac-ty-nho-check-in-giang-sinh-voi-cay-thong-xoay-360-do-101241213182102305.htm

name: Cha Tam Church
description:
Cha Tam Church, officially known as St. Francis Xavier Church, is an ancient church in the city.Ho Chi Minh, famous for its unique architecture blending European style and Asian culture.Built in 1902, this project initially served the Chinese lay community in Cho Lon and was initiated by priest Pierre d'Assou (Vietnamese name is Father Tam).The church is not only a religious site but also an important historical site, especially related to the political event of 1963.
https://mia.vn/cam-nang-du-lich/nha-tho-cha-tam-sai-gon-17689

name: Dong Tien Church
description:
Dong Tien Church is a prominent Catholic church located in District 10, Ho Chi Minh City, known for its unique architecture and being an important center of religious activities of the parish.
https://tgpsaigon.net/gioi-thieu-Giao-xu/dong-tien-851

name: Dominican Church - Three Bells
description:
Dominican Church - Ba Chuong is a famous Catholic parish in Ho Chi Minh City, known for its unique Asian architecture and long history.The name "Three Bells" comes from the three bells mounted on top of the church.
https://www.xanhsm.com/news/nha-tho-da-minh-ba-chuong

name: Francis Da Kao Church
description:
Da Kao Franciscan Church, located in the heart of District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, is a dynamic Catholic parish with a long history, serving as both a place of worship for local parishioners and a center of activity for the Franciscan monastery.
https://tgpsaigon.net/gioi-thieu-Giao-xu/phanxico-dakao-713

name: Saigon Archbishop's Palace
description:
The Saigon Archbishop's Palace is the administrative headquarters of the Archdiocese of Ho Chi Minh City, one of the oldest and most important Catholic dioceses in Vietnam.Located in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City, this campus is famous for having one of the oldest houses in Saigon with a history of more than two centuries.
https://tgpsaigon.net/bai-viet/toa-tong-giam-muc-sai-gon-166

name: Pastoral Center of Saigon Archdiocese
description:
The Saigon Archdiocese Pastoral Center is a multi-purpose center located in District 1, Ho Chi Minh City, with the role of organizing pastoral activities, training and being a meeting place for the Catholic community.
https://tgpsaigon.net/gioi-thieu-Giao-xu/Giao-xu-trung-tam-muc-vu-971

name: Saigon University campus 1
description:
Saigon University Campus 1 is a public university with a long history, located at 273 An Duong Vuong, District 5, Ho Chi Minh City, known for its ancient architecture mixing French and Chinese styles.The school has high quality training, multi-disciplinary training at both undergraduate and graduate levels, and is among the leading universities in Vietnam.
https://cellphones.com.vn/sforum/truong-dai-hoc-sai-gon

name: Saigon University campus 2
description:
Saigon University (SGU) Campus 2 is located at 04 Ton Duc Thang, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, and is an important part of the school's training system, featuring a prime location right in the economic and tourism center of Ho Chi Minh City, near the Saigon River.This is where the office of the Faculty of Early Childhood Education is located and organizes classes for this major and a number of other majors. It is invested in fully equipped facilities, providing a dynamic and convenient learning environment for students to move and access the amenities of the city center.
https://cellphones.com.vn/sforum/truong-dai-hoc-sai-gon

name: Botanical garden
description:
Saigon Zoo and Botanical Gardens is an animal and plant conservation park of more than 20 hectares, located in the heart of District 1, Ho Chi Minh City.This is one of the oldest zoos in the world, with a history of formation and development dating back to 1864.
https://www.vietnamairlines.com/la/vi/useful-information/travel-guide/zoo-and-botnical-gardens-hcm

name: Ho Chi Minh City History Museum
description:
Ho Chi Minh City History Museum is a large and long-standing museum, located at 2 Nguyen Binh Khiem Street, District 1, inside the Zoo and Botanical Garden campus.It owns more than 40,000 artifacts, including 12 national treasures, and displays Vietnamese history and culture from prehistoric times to 1945, as well as Asian cultures.The building is recognized as a National Artistic Architectural Monument with its unique East-West architecture.
https://mia.vn/cam-nang-du-lich/bao-tang-lich-su-thanh-pho-ho-chi-minh-12480

name: Carmelite monastery
description:
Carmelite Monastery is a Catholic religious order specializing in a life of contemplation, silent prayer and sacrifice, with many campuses in Vietnam, especially the historic Saigon Carmelite Monastery.
https://meetup.vn/dia-diem/dan-vien-cat-minh-33-ton-duc-thang-quan-1/

name: Saigon Central Post Office
description:
Saigon Central Post Office is a unique architectural work, combining classic European style with French architecture and a bit of Gothic influence, built from 1886-1891.This building is located at 2, Paris Commune, District 1, opposite Notre Dame Cathedral.In addition to its postal function, this place is also a famous tourist destination, attracting visitors with its historical and architectural beauty.
https://vinpearl.com/vi/kham-pha-kien-truc-doc-dao-va-check-in-tai-buu-dien-trung-tam-sai-gon

name: Consulate General of France
description:
The Consulate General of France in Ho Chi Minh City (Consulat Général de France à Ho Chi Minh Ville) is a diplomatic representative agency of France, with the function of protecting the rights of French citizens and promoting bilateral relations in the southern region of Vietnam.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T%E1%BB%95ng_L%C3%A3nh_s%E1%BB%B1_qu%C3%A1n_Ph%C3%A1p_t%E1%BA%A1i_Th%C3%A0nh_ph%E1%BB%91_H%E1%BB%93_Ch%C3%AD_Minh

name: Basic university of natural sciences 1
description: Campus 1 of the University of Natural Sciences, located at 227 Nguyen Van Cu, District 5, Ho Chi Minh City, stands out with a combination of classical Western and Eastern architecture, especially in the long-standing building blocks, and modern buildings added later.

name: Basic university of natural sciences 2
description: Campus 2 of the University of Natural Sciences (VNU-HCM) is famous for its spacious, airy space and many trees, creating a fresh learning and research environment, different from inner-city campuses.

name: Saigon Railway Transport Joint Stock Company
Wu Chikuso Viet Nam
description: The architecture of Kuretakeso Hotel in Ho Chi Minh City is a delicate combination of modern Japanese style and harmony with Vietnam's local culture and climate, creating a comfortable and unique resort space.

name: State Bank of Vietnam - HCM
description:
The State Bank of Vietnam (SBV) Building in Ho Chi Minh City is an outstanding historical architectural work, representing a unique blend of French architectural styles (especially Art Deco and Neoclassical) and traditional Champa and Khmer decorative art motifs.
https://tuoitre.vn/tru-so-ngan-hang-nha-nuoc-o-tphcm-xung-tam-di-tich-quoc-gia-1114075.htm

name: Ho Chi Minh City Customs Department
description:
The architecture of Ho Chi Minh City Customs Department can refer to two main buildings: the old headquarters and a new project (tower).The ancient headquarters was originally Maison Wang-Tai, which later became the French Customs House and is a historical site.The new project is a 21-storey tower, designed in 2021 by the team of architects Nguyen Van Tuan, Pham The Minh, Nguyen Danh Truong.
https://plo.vn/di-san-vat-the-sai-gon-300-nam-dau-an-toa-nha-hai-quan-post358541.html

name: The new video is fasted.
description:
Sri Thendayuthapani Temple, also known as "Ong Pagoda" or Hindu Temple, is a typical Hindu architectural work of Dravidian (South Indian) style, located at 66 Ton That Thiep Street, District 1, Ho Chi Minh City.The temple has been an important spiritual center for the Tamil immigrant community since more than a century ago.
https://thanhnien.vn/den-co-145-nam-o-phuong-sai-gon-dau-an-thuong-nhan-an-cho-vay-tien-185250819121353883.htm

name: Mariamman Temple
description:
The architecture of Mariamman Temple is characterized by the Dravidian Indian style, featuring colorful and sophisticated decorative motifs.The temple has a high-rise entrance tower called a gopuram, about 12 meters high and decorated with elaborate carvings, creating an impressive appearance.
https://vinpearl.com/vi/mariamman-ngoi-chua-an-do-linh-thieng-giua-long-sai-gon

name: Mr. Subramaniam Swany Temple
description:
Ong Subramaniam Swamy Pagoda in Ho Chi Minh City is a typical example of South Indian (Tamil) temple architecture.The temple stands out for its traditional Hindu features, elaborately decorated with colorful sculptures and idols.
https://vinwonders.com/vi/wonderpedia/news/chua-an-do-sai-gon/

name: Ho Chi Minh City Museum
description:
Ho Chi Minh City Museum (formerly known as Gia Long Palace) stands out with its classical Renaissance architecture that harmoniously combines Western and Eastern influences, designed by French architect Alfred Foulhoux and completed in 1885.
https://www.baotanglichsutphcm.com.vn/gioi-thieu

name: V.A.R Building
description: VAR Building is an office building located in District 1, City.Ho Chi Minh City, with mid-century modern architecture, was completed in 1973. The building stands out with its "flexible" double-layer facade designed by architect Le Van Lam, which both helps cool the space and demonstrates creativity and adaptability to the local climate.In addition, the current VAR building can also refer to another modern office building, with 7 floors, 1 basement and amenities such as elevators, air conditioning and fire protection systems.

name: Ho Chi Minh City General Science Library
description:
Ho Chi Minh City General Science Library is a typical example of Southern Vietnamese Modern architecture, featuring a harmonious combination of modernism and indigenous ethnic architectural elements.The project was designed by architects Nguyen Huu Thien and Bui Quang Hanh and completed in 1971.
https://mia.vn/cam-nang-du-lich/thu-vien-khoa-hoc-tong-hop-tphcm-19284

name: VOH Broadcasting Center
description:
The VOH Broadcast Center building (Voice of the People of Ho Chi Minh City) is an outstanding example of modern Vietnamese architecture, designed by architect Le Van Lam in 1969. This building is highly appreciated for its balance between form and function, especially its ability to adapt to the tropical climate of Saigon.
https://saigoneer.com/vn/vietnam-architecture/16609-%C4%91%C3%A0i-ph%C3%A1t-thanh-v-o-h,-c%C3%B4ng-tr%C3%ACnh-ki%E1%BA%BFn-tr%C3%BAc-g%E1%BA%A1ch-n%E1%BB%91i-l%E1%BB%8Bch-s%E1%BB%AD

name: Reunification Palace
description:
Reunification Palace (or Independence Palace) is an architectural masterpiece by Architect Ngo Viet Thu, featuring a harmonious combination of modern architecture and traditional Eastern philosophical elements.The project was built on a 12-hectare campus, completed in 1967 and became an important historical symbol of Vietnam.
https://dinhdoclap.gov.vn/di-tich/kien-truc-dinh/

name: Thong Nhat Hospital
description: Thong Nhat Hospital, originally Vi Dan Hospital, was designed by Architect Tran Dinh Quyen and stands out with an architectural philosophy that emphasizes ventilation and effective use of the medical environment.

name: Gia Dinh People's Hospital
description:
Gia Dinh People's Hospital is a historical architectural work with traces from the French colonial period, which has been built and expanded through many stages to become a modern general hospital, the last line of Ho Chi Minh City.
https://bvndgiadinh.org.vn/?page_id=2710#:~:text=L%E1%BB%8Bch%20s%E1%BB%AD%20h%C3%ACnh%20th%C3%A0nh,HCM.

name: Orthopedic Trauma Hospital
description: Orthopedic Trauma Hospital (CTCH Hospital) has the typical architecture of a medical facility that has existed for a long time and gone through many stages of development, with existing facilities being degraded and overloaded, leading to an urgent need to build new and expand facilities.

name: Phu Chau temple
description:
Phu Chau Temple, often called Floating Temple, is a unique spiritual architectural work located in the middle of the Vam Thuat River, featuring a harmonious combination of Vietnamese and Chinese architectural styles.The biggest architectural highlight of the temple is the huge number of decorative dragons, estimated to be nearly 100 exquisitely carved dragons.
https://www.xanhsm.com/news/phu-chau-mieu

name: Thu Thiem Parish
description:
Thu Thiem Parish stands out with its religious architectural complex nearly two centuries old, imbued with French architectural style harmoniously combined with Asian culture.This work, along with the Convent of the Lovers of the Holy Cross Thu Thiem, has been ranked as a City-level Artistic Architectural Monument.
https://mia.vn/cam-nang-du-lich/nha-tho-thu-thiem-sai-gon-19174

name: Le Hong Phong High School for the Gifted
description:
Le Hong Phong High School for the Gifted (formerly Collège Pétrus Truong Vinh Ky, founded in 1927) stands out with its ancient architectural complex, a harmonious combination of classical French architectural style and Indochina architecture.The project has been recognized as a City-level Artistic Architectural Monument.
https://plo.vn/truong-le-hong-phong-duoc-cong-nhan-di-tich-kien-truc-nghe-thuat-post364096.html

name: Le Quy Don High School
description:
Le Quy Don High School (formerly Collège Chasseloup-Laubat, founded in 1874) is the first and oldest high school in Saigon, featuring classical French architecture, built in the characteristic "khau" (口) shape.This work has been recognized as a City-level Artistic Architectural Monument.
https://thpt-lequydon-hcm.edu.vn/info/SP1775/Truong-Trung-Hoc-Dau-Tien-O-Tphcm-Duoc-Xep-Hang-Di-Tich-Tp.html#:~:text=Ng%C3%B4i%20tr%C6%B0%E1%BB%9Dng%20c%C3%B3%20tu%E1%BB%95i%20%C4%91%E1%BB%9Di,Minh%20Khai%20sau%20146%20n%C4%83m.

name: Nguyen Thi Minh Khai High School
description:
Nguyen Thi Minh Khai High School (established in 1913, first called Collège des Jeunes Filles, later Gia Long High School for Girls) stands out with its Gothic architecture of the early 20th century.This is one of the oldest schools in the city.Ho Chi Minh City and has been recognized as a City-level Architectural and Artistic Monument.
https://jvs.vn/truong-thpt-nguyen-thi-minh-khai-di-tich-kien-truc-nghe-thuat-cap-tp-hcm/#:~:text=Tr%C6%B0%E1%BB%9Dng%20High School%20Nguy%E1%BB%85n%20Th%E1%BB%8B%20Minh,B%E1%BB%8A%20GI%C3%81O%20D%E1%BB%A4C%2C%20V%C4%82N%20PH%C3%92NG

name: Tran Dai Nghia High School for the Gifted
description:
Tran Dai Nghia High School for the Gifted (formerly Collège La San Taberd, founded in 1874) stands out with its harmonious Indochinese architecture, combining classic French style and local climate characteristics.This is one of the oldest schools and has the most beautiful architecture in the city.Ho Chi Minh City, has been recognized as a City-level Architectural and Artistic Monument.
https://cafef.vn/co-mot-ngoi-truong-chuyen-gan-150-nam-tuoi-doi-kien-truc-co-lanh-day-lang-man-muon-vao-day-phai-hoc-cuc-gioi-20221102091939937.chn#:~:text=C%C3%B3%20m%E1%BB%99t%20ng%C3%B4i%20tr%C6%B0%E1%BB%9Dng%20chuy%C3%AAn,%C4%91%C3%A2y%20ph%E1%BA%A3i%20h%E1%BB%8Dc%20c%E1%BB%B1c%20gi%E1%BB%8Fi!

name: THPT Marie Curie
description:
Marie Curie High School (established in 1918 with the original name Lycée Marie Curie) stands out with its harmonious Indochinese architecture, combining classic French style and local climate characteristics.The project was recognized as a City-level Historical-Cultural and Scenic Site in 2015.
https://vietnam.vnanet.vn/vietnamese/tin-tuc/co-lanh-truong-marie-curie-tp-ho-chi-minh-71278.html#:~:text=N%C3%A9t%20th%C6%B0%E1%BB%9Bt%20tha%20trong%20t%C3%A0,lu%C3%B4n%20cao%20h%C6%A1n%20n%C4%83m%20tr%C6%B0%E1%BB%9Bc.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Labor Cultural Palace
description: Ho Chi Minh City Labor Cultural Palace, located at 55B Nguyen Thi Minh Khai, District 1, is an architectural complex and space for cultural activities and sports for workers.

name: Phuong Nam Villa (District 3)
description:
Phuong Nam Villa (located at 110-112 Vo Van Tan, Ward 6, District 3) is one of the oldest and most valuable ancient villas in the city.Ho Chi Minh City, stands out with its classic French architectural style.
https://vietnamnet.vn/dieu-it-biet-ve-can-biet-thu-100-tuoi-35-million-usd-o-sai-gon-268518.html#:~:text=*%20bi%E1%BB%87t%20th%E1%BB%B1%20*%20L%C3%A2u%20%C4%91%C3%A0i.%20*,USD.%20*%20Ph%C3%A1p%20c%E1%BB%95%20*%20s%C3%A0i%20gon.

name: Chantarangsay Pagoda
description:
Chantarangsay Pagoda (also known as Candaransi Pagoda or Khmer Pagoda District 3) is a Khmer Theravada Buddhist temple in the city.Ho Chi Minh.The pagoda stands out with its unique Khmer architecture, rich in color and intricately carved details, and is the center of religious and cultural activities of the Khmer community in the city.
https://www.xanhsm.com/news/chua-chantarangsay

name: Pothiwong temple
description:
Pothiwong Pagoda (official name is Bodhivangsa Pathi Vong Wat) is located at 21/2 Bui The My, Ward 10, Tan Binh District, City.Ho Chi Minh.The pagoda is one of the Khmer pagodas of the Theravada Buddhist sect in the city, outstanding with traditional Khmer architecture built in a multi-storey form, adapting to a small area in urban areas.
https://www.tapchinghiencuuphathoc.vn/chua-pothiwong.html

name: Turtle Lake
description:
Turtle Lake, officially known as International Construction Site, is a modern architectural work, designed by architect Nguyen Ky in the period 1965–1967.This work stands out with its feng shui design and stylized images, and was once an important symbol of ancient Saigon.
https://greenfuture.tech/tin-tuc/ho-con-rua

name: Jamiul Islamiyah Mosque
description: Jamiul Islamiyah Mosque, located at 459 Tran Hung Dao, District 1, City.Ho Chi Minh City, built in 1950. This is a place of worship for the Muslim community, especially the Cham Muslims who came from South India in the past.

name: Cho Lon Mosque
description: Cholon Jamial Mosque, located at 639 Nguyen Trai, Ward 11, District 5, City.Ho Chi Minh, is one of the oldest cathedrals in the Cho Lon area.This project stands out with its typical Indian architecture, creating a unique cultural highlight in the Chinatown area.

name: Al Rahim Mosque
description: Al Rahim Mosque, located at 45 Nam Ky Khoi Nghia, Nguyen Thai Binh Ward, District 1, City.Ho Chi Minh City, is one of the oldest places of Muslim worship in Vietnam.This mosque mainly serves the Muslim community of Malaysian and Indonesian origin.

name: Al Musulman Mosque
description: Jamia Al-Musulman Mosque (also known as Saigon Central Mosque or Great Musulman Mosque), located at 66 Dong Du, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1, City.Ho Chi Minh City, is the largest mosque and the main place of worship for the Muslim community in the city center.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Geological Museum
description: Ho Chi Minh City Geological Museum, located at 2 Nguyen Binh Khiem, District 1 (shared campus with the History Museum), stands out with Indochina architecture, combining classic French style and indigenous features, creating an ancient, harmonious and airy space.The building was originally built for geological and mineral research.

name: On Lang Assembly Hall
description:
On Lang Assembly Hall, also known as Quan Am Pagoda, is a national architectural and artistic relic, demonstrating the unique cultural interference of the Chinese community in Cho Lon.
https://vinpearl.com/vi/ghe-tham-hoi-quan-on-lang-kien-truc-trung-hoa-giua-long-sai-thanh

name: Thorako headquarters
description: The headquarters of Thorakao cosmetics is located at 241 Bis Cach Mang Thang Tam, Ward 4, District 3, Ho Chi Minh City.This building stands out with modern architecture in the style of 20th century Saigon.

name: Phu Binh lantern craft village
description:
Phu Binh lantern craft village in District 11, Ho Chi Minh City, does not have the typical architecture of a traditional craft village, but mainly households produce and display lanterns right at their homes in a small alley.Therefore, this craft village does not have fixed opening hours but depends on each household.The best time to visit is during the Mid-Autumn Festival, when houses are filled with colorful lanterns.
https://en.nhandan.vn/phu-binh-villagers-strive-to-preserve-the-craft-of-lantern-making-post90118.html#:~:text=Despite%20facing%20challenges%20from%20COVID,frames%20after%20his%20working%20time.

name: Phu Nhuan Communal House
description: Phu Nhuan Communal House, a National Artistic Architectural Monument, is famous for its traditional Southern communal house architecture that has been preserved through many restorations.

name: Tomb of Left Army Le Van Duyet
description: Tomb of Left Army Le Van Duyet (also known as Tomb of Mr. and Mrs. Chieu).The tomb area stands out with traditional Nguyen Dynasty royal architecture, is large and solemn, and is one of the oldest and most sacred architectural works in Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Museum of Fine Arts
description:
Built from 1929 to 1934, the Ho Chi Minh City Museum of Fine Arts is an architectural masterpiece that harmoniously combines French colonial style, Asian architecture and the popular Art Deco style of that time.
https://mia.vn/cam-nang-du-lich/bao-tang-my-thuat-thanh-pho-ho-chi-minh-12419

name: Children's Hospital 2
description:
Children's Hospital 2 is a classic French architectural work with a history of more than 150 years and has been recognized as an architectural and artistic relic.
https://baolamdong.vn/di-tich-kien-truc-nghe-thuat-benh-vien-nhi-dong-2-100349.html#:~:text=B%E1%BB%87nh%20vi%E1%BB%87n%20(BV)%20Nhi%20%C4%91%E1%BB%93ng%202%20%C4%91%C6%B0%E1%BB%A3c,ti%E1%BB%81n%20%C4%91%C6%B0%E1%BB%9Dng:%20L%C3%BD%20T%E1%BB%B1%20Tr%E1%BB%8Dng%2C%20Chu%20M%E1%BA%A1nh

name: Hao Sy Phuong
description:
Hao Sy Phuong is an apartment alley that has existed for more than 100 years, famous for its unique architecture that blends Vietnamese, French and Chinese cultures.This is a residential area where real people live, not an official tourist destination with fixed opening hours.
https://wanderlog.com/place/details/853948/hao-sy-phuong

name: Cao Thang Apartment
description:
Cao Thang Street in Ho Chi Minh City has several apartment complexes, from old buildings with historical value to modern complexes.The most prominent apartment complex in terms of architecture that is often mentioned is the ancient apartment complex designed by Architect Paul Veysseyre in the 1920s and 1930s, with the first Modernist architectural style in Saigon.
https://www.tanmankientruc.org/kien-truc/modernist-series/chung-cu-cao-thang

name: Consulate General of Russia in Ho Chi Minh City
description: The Consulate General of Russia in Ho Chi Minh City is the diplomatic representative agency of the Russian Federation, in charge of the southern provinces and part of the South Central region of Vietnam.This agency is responsible for consular matters, including visa issuance and related services for Russian citizens and Vietnamese citizens.

name: Memorial temple of Hung Kings
description: The Hung Kings Memorial Temple at the National History - Culture Park (often called the old Hung Kings Temple in District 9) is one of the largest places to worship Hung Kings in the Southern region.

name: Temple of King Hung (Botanical Garden)
description: Hung King Temple is an important historical and cultural relic, located in the Zoo campus in the center of District 1. The temple was built around 1930 - 1932, worshiping the Hung King and has a traditional Eastern architectural style, a place for people to remember and pay tribute to the merits of the Hung Kings.

name: Ho Chi Minh City University of Medicine and Pharmacy
description: It is one of the leading medical universities in Vietnam, established in 1947, located in the city center.The school has a mission to train high-quality medical human resources for the southern region and the whole country, with many affiliated facilities, departments and a practice hospital.

name: Hoa Binh Theater
description: Hoa Binh Theater is one of the largest and most famous venues for cultural, artistic, conference, and seminar events in Ho Chi Minh City.With a main auditorium that can accommodate more than 2,000 spectators and a modern sound and lighting system, the theater is often where music shows, comedy shows and student graduation ceremonies take place.

name: Vietnam National Tu
description: It is one of the largest and most important temples in Ho Chi Minh City, considered a symbol of the development and unity of Buddhism in the South.The pagoda stands out with its 63-meter high 13-storey stupa (the tallest Buddhist tower in Vietnam today), which enshrines the immortal heart relic of Bodhisattva Thich Quang Duc.

name: Vinh Nghiem Pagoda
description: It is one of the most famous and largest pagodas in Ho Chi Minh City, built in 1964. The pagoda has the traditional Buddhist architecture of Northern Vietnam, with the highlight being the highest Vinh Nghiem stone tower in Vietnam and the Avalokiteśvara tower.

name: Giac Lam Pagoda
description: It is one of the oldest pagodas in Ho Chi Minh City with a date of nearly 300 years, built in 1744. Giac Lam Pagoda is a national historical-cultural relic and an important Buddhist center in the South.The pagoda has the typical architecture of Southern pagodas with a "Tam" shaped layout and possesses many ancient statues and precious dharma objects.

name: Phap Hoa Pagoda
description: It is an ancient temple located on the banks of Nhieu Loc canal, established in 1928 and has undergone many restorations.The pagoda has unique architecture and a peaceful space in the heart of the bustling city.In particular, on major holidays such as Buddha's Birthday, the pagoda is famous for its ceremony of releasing colorful lanterns on the canal.

name: Ho Chi Minh Museum - Ho Chi Minh City Branch
description: The museum is located in the historic Nha Rong Wharf building, where President Ho Chi Minh (then young man Nguyen Tat Thanh) boarded a ship to leave the country to find a way to save the country on June 5, 1911. The museum displays many documents, artifacts and images about the life and revolutionary career of President Ho Chi Minh.

name: Jade Emperor Palace
description: The Jade Emperor Palace, also known as Phuoc Hai Tu (the French call it Da Kao Pagoda), is an ancient temple with strong Chinese architectural imprints, located in the center of District 1. This is the place to worship the Jade Emperor and Taoist gods, famous as a sacred place to pray for children, love, and peace.The palace owns more than 300 exquisitely carved wooden statues, which are valuable works of art.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Theater
description: Built in 1898 and inaugurated in 1900, the City Theater is an ancient architectural work with a strong French style, designed by architect Eugène Ferret.Located in the heart of District 1, this is a cultural and artistic symbol of the city, and is recognized as a national architectural and artistic monument.

name: Minh Huong Gia Thanh Assembly Hall
description: Minh Huong Gia Thanh Hoi Quan, also known as Minh Huong communal house, is one of the oldest communal houses of Vietnamese-Chinese people in Saigon - Cho Lon.Built in 1789, the communal house is a place to worship the Tutelary Gods and the ancestors who founded the village.The architecture of the communal house is a blend of Vietnamese and Chinese cultures.

name: Binh Dong communal house
description: Binh Dong communal house is a national historical-cultural relic, more than 170 years old, located on Ba Tang island, District 8, Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Phong Phu Communal House
description: Phong Phu Communal House is a national revolutionary historical and cultural relic, located in Thu Duc City.

name: Chi Hoa Communal House
description: Chi Hoa Communal House is one of the oldest communal houses in Ho Chi Minh City, nearly 300 years old, and is recognized as a National Cultural and Historical Monument.

name: Hoi Son Pagoda
description: This is one of the ancient and important temples in Thu Duc City (formerly District 9), with a history of more than 300 years.Hoi Son Pagoda was recognized by the Ministry of Culture and Information as a national architectural and artistic relic in 1993.

name: Phuoc Tuong Pagoda
description: As one of the ancient pagodas more than 300 years old, it was recognized by the Ministry of Culture and Information as a national historical and cultural relic in terms of architecture and art.The pagoda has a traditional Southern pagoda architectural style, outstanding with inverted L-shaped rows of houses and the "Phuoc Tuong Tu" horizontal panel dating from the reign of King Minh Mang.

name: Giac Vien Pagoda
description: It is one of the oldest and most important pagodas in Ho Chi Minh City with more than 200 years old, recognized by the Ministry of Culture and Information as a National Architectural and Artistic Monument in 1993. The pagoda is also known as "Ho Dat Pagoda", with a unique architecture imbued with the traditions of the ancient land of Gia Dinh, especially the sophisticated wood carving system.

name: Binh Hoa Communal House
description: Binh Hoa communal house is a national architectural and artistic relic, built around the beginning of the 19th century (over 200 years old) in the ancient Gia Dinh area, now in Binh Thanh district, Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Dinh Thong Tay Hoi
description: Thong Tay Hoi Communal House, before 1944 called Hanh Thong Tay communal house, is the oldest communal house in the Southern region, built around 1679.

name: Truong Tho Sac Tu Pagoda
description: It is one of the oldest pagodas in Saigon, with a history of nearly 300 years, located in Go Vap district, Ho Chi Minh City.The pagoda's original name was Vinh Truong Tu, belonging to the Lam Te Lieu Quan lineage, then King Tu Duc granted the "four colors" and changed its name to Sac Tu Truong Tho Tu.

name: Lang Vo Di Nguy
description: Mausoleum of Vo Di Nguy is a national architectural and artistic relic in Ho Chi Minh City, a place to bury and worship Binh Giang Duke Vo Di Nguy (1745 - 1801) - a famous naval general who made great contributions to helping King Gia Long unify the country.

name: Truong Tan Buu's mausoleum
description: Truong Tan Buu Tomb, also known as Vo Tanh Tomb or Double Burial Tomb, is a national historical and cultural relic.This is the burial place of the couple of two Nguyen Dynasty generals: Mr. Truong Tan Buu (real name Truong Tan Thuy) and Mr. Vo Tanh.Both are civil servants who have made great contributions to supporting King Gia Long.

name: Truong Tho Communal House
description: Truong Tho Communal House is an ancient communal house located in Truong Tho Ward, Thu Duc City.This is a place to worship the original tutelary god, with long-standing historical and cultural value, associated with the process of reclamation and religious activities of local people.

name: Xuan Hiep Communal House
description: Xuan Hiep communal house is an ancient communal house located in Linh Trung ward, Thu Duc city.This is a place to worship the Tutelary God and the predecessors who discovered and preserved the ancient land of Xuan Hiep.

name: Tan Phuoc Communal House
description: Tan Phuoc Communal House is an ancient communal house with long-standing historical and cultural value in District 10, Ho Chi Minh City, located in Ward 6.

name: Ernst Thälmann High School
description: Ernst Thälmann High School, often referred to as Ten Lo Man High School, is a school with a rich history and is one of the public schools in Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Truong family temple
description: The Truong family temple, also known as Truong Thi Dai Tong Tu, is located in the center of Cho Lon area.This is a place of worship and religious activities of the Chinese community with the surname Truong in Saigon.The temple has unique architecture, imbued with Southern Chinese culture.

name: Go Queo ancient tomb park
description: Go Queo Ancient Tomb Park is a complex of 17 ancient tombs, dating back to the Nguyen Dynasty, located in Binh Trung Dong Ward, City.Thu Duc.In particular, there are the tombs of two Nguyen Dynasty mandarins, Left Governor Pham Quang Triet and Ninh Thai Governor Pham Duy Trinh.

name: Long Binh Than Temple
description: Long Binh Than Communal House located in Long Binh Ward, Thu Duc City, is one of the ancient communal houses of this land.

name: Long Hoa Than Temple
description: Long Hoa Than Communal House is an ancient communal house located in District 10, Ho Chi Minh City, in Ward 11. The communal house is a place to worship the Tutelary God.

name: Dinh Than An Khanh
description: An Khanh Than Communal House is an ancient communal house located in An Khanh ward, Thu Duc City.

name: Museum of Vietnamese Traditional Medicine
description: Vietnam Traditional Medicine Museum is the first private museum in Vietnam in the field of traditional medicine, established in 2003 and located in District 10, Ho Chi Minh City.The museum displays about 3,000 artifacts, documents, and ancient books related to traditional medicine through historical periods, from stone age to feudal dynasties.

name: Trung Vuong High School
description: Trung Vuong High School is one of the oldest and famous public schools in Ho Chi Minh City, located in the center of District 1. The school has a history dating back to 1917 and has been recognized as a City-level architectural monument in 2025.

name: Temple of Saint Tran Hung Dao
description: The Temple of Saint Tran Hung Dao is a city-level architectural and artistic relic, built in 1932.

name: Tomb of the Ministry of Military Censorship, Minister of the Tran family
description: This is the name of an ancient tomb of the Tran family built during the Nguyen Dynasty, located in Ward 3, Go Vap District, Ho Chi Minh City.The tomb is a City-level historical and cultural relic, preserved for its architectural values, stone sculpture art and ancient epitaphs.

name: Memorial area of ​​Phan Chau Trinh's grave
description: Phan Chau Trinh's grave memorial area is a national historical site, the resting place of patriotic scholar Phan Chau Trinh.

name: Tan Ky Temple - Ong Bon Temple
description: Tan Ky Temple, also known as Ong Bon Temple, is located in the center of District 1, Ho Chi Minh City.This is an ancient temple of the Chinese community (of Hokkien origin) in Saigon."Mr. Bon" is the respectful name of the Chinese for the local Tutelary God, the protector of the community and the business and trading sector.

name: Southern Air Force Museum
description: The Southern Air Force Museum is a place to display and preserve many artifacts, aircraft, equipment, and weapons of the Vietnam Air Force through the ages, especially during the resistance war against the US.

name: Hoang Van Thu Park
description: Hoang Van Thu Park is one of the major "green lungs" of Ho Chi Minh City, located in the center of Tan Binh District, right near Tan Son Nhat airport.

name: Phu Xuan Communal House, Nha Be
description: Phu Xuan Communal House is located in Nha Be District, Ho Chi Minh City, and was ranked by the City People's Committee as a City-level architectural and artistic relic in 2012. The communal house is located in a spacious campus with many trees, on the banks of Rach Doi.

name: Mausoleum of Ong Thuy Tuong
description: Mausoleum of Ong Thuy Tuong is the folk name of Than Thang Tam Communal House (also known as Lang Ong Nam Hai), a famous national historical and cultural relic in Vung Tau city.This place worships God Nam Hai (whale), the guardian deity of fishermen according to coastal folk beliefs.The mausoleum complex includes three temples: Ba Temple, Ong Temple and Ong Thuy Tuong Mausoleum.A special feature is that this place also preserves the largest whale skeleton in Vietnam.Nghinh Ong Thang Tam Festival takes place every year and is one of the largest festivals in the Southern region.

name: Dinh Duong Van Hanh
description: Duong Van Hanh communal house is a folk worship facility whose name is associated with the history of the ancient land of Thu Duc.This name commemorates a historical figure or an ancestor who made a discovery.

name: Binh Khanh Communal House - Tomb of Sage Tran Quang Dao
description: Binh Khanh communal house and Tran Quang Dao's tomb are a city-level historical and cultural relic complex, located in Binh Khanh ward, city.Thu Duc

name: Phu Lac Communal House
description: Phu Lac communal house is a city-level architectural and artistic relic, located in Long Truong ward, city.Thu Duc.This communal house is more than 200 years old, built in the style of traditional Southern communal house architecture, with yin and yang tiled roofs and intricately carved motifs.

name: Binh Truong Communal House
description: Binh Truong communal house is an ancient communal house located in Truong Tho ward, city.Thu Duc, Ho Chi Minh City.The communal house is a place to worship the original Tutelary God and the predecessors who have contributed to the discovery and preservation of this land.

name: An Phu Communal House
description: An Phu communal house (also known as "Phuoc An Mieu Vu") is an ancient communal house built in the early 19th century, located in An Phu ward, City.Thu Duc (formerly in District 2).

name: Minh Dang Quang Court
description: Minh Dang Quang Dharma Court is a massive Buddhist architectural work, built according to the model of the Four Hearts of Buddhism, belonging to the Mendicant Buddhist Sect.

name: Phuoc Long Pagoda (Thu Duc)
description: This pagoda is located on Ba Sang island (Long Binh island), in the middle of Dong Nai river, and is considered a unique "spiritual oasis".Chau Doc 3 Pagoda or Phuoc Long Pagoda, worshiping the Holy Mother of Chau Doc, is a famous pilgrimage site in the city.Thu Duc.

name: Nam Thien Nhat Tru Pagoda
description: Nam Thien Nhat Tru Pagoda, also known as the "One Pillar Pagoda" of the South, is a unique Buddhist architectural work in the city.Thu Duc, Ho Chi Minh City.The pagoda was built in 1958, simulating the architecture of the One Pillar Pagoda in Hanoi but with a smaller size.

name: Thu Duc Parish
description: Thu Duc Parish is a large Catholic community with a long history, located in the administrative center of Thu Duc City.

name: Ao Dai Museum
description: Ao Dai Museum is a space to display, honor and introduce the history of Vietnamese Ao Dai through many different periods.With a diverse collection of more than 300 ao dai models, the museum offers a comprehensive view of the development of this traditional outfit.

name: That Phu Thien Hau Palace
description: That Phu Thien Hau Cung, commonly known by the short name Ba Thien Hau Pagoda or Ba Thien Hau Temple, is one of the oldest and largest temples of the Chinese community in Ho Chi Minh City.Located in the center of Cho Lon (District 5), this temple worships Thien Hau Thanh Mau (Chinese call it Ma To), the patron god of seafarers.The temple has unique architecture, exquisite sculpture, and is famous for its sacredness, especially during the Lunar New Year.The temple has been recognized as a national architectural and artistic relic.

name: An Hoi Communal House
description: An Hoi Communal House is one of the oldest communal houses in Ho Chi Minh City, built in the early 19th century.This is a national historical-cultural relic.

name: Sa Tan Temple
description: Sa Tan Temple (Ky Thanh Thuy Long Cung) is a City-level architectural and artistic relic, located in Go Vap District.The temple worships Mother Goddess Thuy Long, associated with the local Mother Goddess worship culture.Legend has it that this is the place where a strange statue was recovered and people built a temple to worship it, becoming famous for its sacredness. It is also a ferry station to go to Phu Chau Floating Temple in the middle of the Vam Thuat River.

name: Sac Tu Tap Phuoc Pagoda
description: Sac Tu Tap Phuoc Pagoda, also known as Tap Phuoc Pagoda, is an ancient pagoda with a long history (certified by King Gia Long in 1802) in Binh Thanh District, Ho Chi Minh City.The pagoda has been recognized as a City-level architectural and artistic relic.This place is famous for the story of Lord Nguyen Phuc Anh who took refuge here when being chased by the Tay Son army.

name: Long Thanh Pagoda (Binh Tan)
description: Long Thanh Pagoda, also known as Long Thanh Ancestral Temple, is an ancient pagoda with a long history (about 280 years old), located in Binh Tan District, Ho Chi Minh City.The pagoda was once a famous Buddhist institution and Dharma propagation center in the six provinces of Cochinchina.

name: Dinh Binh Tri Dong
description: Binh Tri Dong Communal House, also known as Cay Da Sa Communal House, is a City-level historical and cultural relic.The temple worships the original Tutelary God and the predecessors who explored this land.

name: Binh Thuan Parish (Binh Tan)
description: Binh Thuan Parish belongs to Tan Son Nhi District, Ho Chi Minh City Archdiocese, located in Binh Tan District.The parish was established in 1966 and re-established in 1996. This is a large Catholic community whose patron is Our Lady of the Rosary.

name: St. Paul Parish (Binh Tan)
description: St. Paul Parish, also known as St. Paul the Rocket Church, is one of the largest parishes with modern architecture in Binh Tan District, belonging to the Archdiocese of Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Thien An Parish
description: Thien An Parish is a Catholic community belonging to the Archdiocese of Ho Chi Minh City, located in Tan Phu District.

name: Tan Thai Son Parish
description: Tan Thai Son Parish was established in 1957, belonging to the Archdiocese of Ho Chi Minh City.This name originates from the fact that this place is a settlement camp for Thai Binh migrants to Saigon.

name: Tan Phu Parish
description: Tan Phu Parish is one of the large parishes with a long history in Tan Phu District, Ho Chi Minh City, belonging to the Archdiocese of Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Phu Trung Parish
description: Phu Trung Parish is a Catholic community belonging to the Archdiocese of Ho Chi Minh City, located in Tan Phu District.

name: Phu Tho Hoa Parish
description: Phu Tho Hoa Parish is a long-standing Catholic community in Tan Phu District, Ho Chi Minh City, belonging to the Archdiocese of Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Dac Lo Parish
description: Dac Lo Parish is a Catholic community belonging to the Archdiocese of Ho Chi Minh City.The parish was established in 1958, with its patron Saint John the Baptist.This name was given to commemorate the merits of missionary Alexandre de Rhodes (also known as Father Dac Lo), who had great contributions in evangelizing and giving birth to the Vietnamese language in Vietnam.

name: Hanh Phu Communal House
description: Hanh Phu Communal House is an important historical site, located in An Phu Dong Ward, District 12, Ho Chi Minh City.During the resistance war against the French, this communal house used to be the food warehouse of the Gia Dinh Provincial Supply Board at An Phu Dong base.The communal house has been recognized by the Ho Chi Minh City People's Committee as a City-level historical relic.

name: Nguyen Anh Thu Temple
description: Nguyen Anh Thu Temple is a City-level historical relic, established by the people to commemorate patriotic hero Nguyen Anh Thu (1821–1871).

name: An Quang Pagoda
description: An Quang Pagoda, also known as An Quang Pagoda, is one of the ancient pagodas and plays an important role in the history of modern Vietnamese Buddhism, especially Southern Buddhism.The pagoda was built by Venerable Thich Tri Huu in 1948.

name: Tu Nghiem Pagoda
description: Tu Nghiem Pagoda is a nun temple located in District 10, Ho Chi Minh City, established in the 1950s and officially assigned to nuns in 1957.

name: Long Hoa Pagoda (District 8)
description: Long Hoa Pagoda belongs to Hoa Buddhism, built by Venerable Thuong Sieu Ha Tran in 1958 in District 8, Ho Chi Minh City.The pagoda has a spacious and spacious space and regularly organizes charity activities.

name: An Phu Pagoda (Mien Sanh Pagoda)
description: An Phu Pagoda, also known by the folk name "Mieng Sanh Pagoda", is located in District 8, Ho Chi Minh City.A special feature of this temple is that almost the entire building is decorated with dozens of tons of broken ceramic and porcelain pieces from cups, bowls, plates, and teapots.

name: Giac Hai Pagoda (District 6)
description: Giac Hai Pagoda is an ancient pagoda located in District 6, Ho Chi Minh City, founded in 1887. The pagoda was originally called Giac Son, later renamed Giac Hai.

name: Hoa Binh Communal House, Hoa Binh Park
description: Hoa Binh Park is a public green space.This is a place for local people to entertain and relax, with many trees and areas for children.

name: Hue Nghiem Pagoda
description: Hue Nghiem Pagoda, also known as Hue Nghiem Buddhist Academy, is one of the oldest monasteries in Saigon.The pagoda was founded by Venerable Thich Thien Hoa in 1962. This is a place dedicated to studying and practicing the precepts of monks, especially at Hue Nghiem Precept Monastery.

name: Hai Thuong Lan Ong ancient house area
description: Old House Area and Bac Hai Thuong Lan Ong Medicine Street is a long-standing commercial area in District 5, Ho Chi Minh City, famous for its unique Chinese architecture, traditional Chinese medicine shops and a center for selling lanterns and decorations during festivals.

name: Vinh Hoi Communal House
description: Vinh Hoi Communal House is a city-level architectural and artistic relic, built in 1820.

name: Dinh Khanh Hoi
description: Khanh Hoi Communal House is a city-level architectural and artistic relic.The communal house was established in 1852 and re-established in 1937. Located on Nguyen Tat Thanh street, the communal house is a sacred space, retains its ancient features, and is a prominent cultural destination in District 4.

name: Southern Women's Museum
description: The Southern Women's Museum was established in 1985. This is a place to store and display artifacts, images, and documents about the history of the struggle, cultural traditions and the great contributions of Southern women in the resistance wars and national construction.The museum has many valuable collections of costumes, jewelry and customs of Southern women through the ages.

name: War Remnants Museum
description: War Remnants Museum is a famous historical museum in Ho Chi Minh City, specializing in researching, collecting, storing and displaying documents, images, and artifacts about the evidence, crimes and consequences of wars in Vietnam.The museum preserves more than 20,000 valuable documents and artifacts donated by veterans, journalists and international friends, serving as a space for dialogue and reconciliation, reminding of the value of peace.

name: Xuan Hoa Communal House
description: Xuan Hoa Communal House is an ancient historical and cultural relic, bearing the mark of ancient village culture in the heart of Ho Chi Minh City.The communal house was built in the 19th century and is a place to worship the Thanh Hoang and his predecessors and successors, expressing the customs, beliefs and solidarity of the local people.

name: Temple of Ba Thien Hau Thanh Mau
description: This is one of the oldest and most sacred religious establishments of the Chinese community in Saigon, built around 1760. The pagoda worships Thien Hau Thanh Mau (Mazu), the goddess who protects seafarers.The project stands out with its sophisticated traditional Chinese architecture, with many worship objects, large incense rings and pairs of antique tureens and horizontal panels, attracting a large number of tourists and local people to pray for peace.

name: Phu Thanh Communal House (District 3)
description: Phu Thanh Communal House is a city-level architectural relic in District 3. The communal house was built in the early 19th century and still retains the ordination from the Nguyen Dynasty in 1853. This is one of the oldest communal houses in the area, worshiping Thanh Hoang Bon Canh and his predecessors and later sages.

name: Water tower (District 3)
description: This water tower was built by the French in 1886, and is the oldest water tower still standing in Saigon.It is located on the campus of Saigon Water Supply Corporation (SAWACO) right at the International Construction Site (Turtle Lake area).The project has unique architecture and was once considered to be preserved as a water industry museum.However, to ensure safety, this place is currently not open to the public to visit inside.

name: Xa Loi Pagoda
description: Xa Loi Pagoda is the first pagoda in Ho Chi Minh City built with modern architecture, starting in 1956. The pagoda is located on a large campus and stands out with a seven-story bell tower, built in 1960.

name: Nguyen Van Binh Book Street
description: Nguyen Van Binh Book Street is a tree-lined walking street, located right in the center of District 1. This is a typical cultural space, where many booths of major publishers gather, selling many different genres of books.

name: Continental Saigon Hotel
description: Continental Saigon Hotel is one of the oldest and most famous hotels in the center of District 1, Ho Chi Minh City.Built in 1880 with ancient French architecture, the hotel is imbued with history, located right opposite the City Theater.

name: Thu Ngu flagpole
description: Thu Ngu flagpole is a historical relic and a famous cultural symbol of Ho Chi Minh City, located right on the banks of the Saigon River, at the river confluence.The flagpole was built by the French in 1865 with the original purpose of being an information station for ships entering and leaving Saigon port.Today, Thu Ngu Flagpole has been restored, becoming a historical attraction and a prominent symbol on Bach Dang Wharf.

name: Apartment 130 Pasteur, Ben Nghe, District 1
description: Apartment 130 Pasteur, Ben Nghe Ward, District 1 is an old apartment complex located in a prime location in the city center.There are many serviced apartments and homestays for rent here.

name: Banking University (Main Campus)
description: Banking University Ho Chi Minh City (BUH) is a public, multidisciplinary university under the State Bank of Vietnam.The school offers training in economics, finance, banking, accounting, and business administration.The main campus is located in District 1, specializing in administrative work and some teaching activities.

name: Residence 30 (District 3)
description: April 30 Residence is a residential and office area with a prime location in District 3

name: Our Lady of Peace Bookstore
description: Our Lady of Peace Bookstore is a Catholic bookstore, specializing in providing books, tapes, statues and other Catholic items.

name: Don Bosco Xuan Hiep
description: Don Bosco Xuan Hiep Community is a base of the Don Bosco Salesian order, including a church (Xuan Hiep Parish), a monastery, and educational and vocational training facilities.

name: Polytechnic University (Campus 1)
description: Polytechnic University (VNU Ho Chi Minh City) is the leading university of engineering and technology in Vietnam.Campus 1 is located in District 10, is the learning place for many faculties, departments and important functional areas of the school.

name: Tu Duc Parish
description: Tu Duc Parish is a Catholic community belonging to Phu Nhuan Parish, Ho Chi Minh City Archdiocese.

name: Le Thanh B Theater
description: Le Thanh B Theater is a once famous movie theater in the Cho Lon area, District 5, located at the corner of Phan Phu Tien and Tran Hung Dao B streets. Along with Le Thanh A theater, this is one of the vibrant cultural entertainment venues of old Saigon.However, the theater stopped operating a long time ago and is now degraded, only a cultural relic with many memories.

name: Workers Theater
description: Cong Nhan Theater is one of the oldest theaters in Ho Chi Minh City, with a history dating back to the French colonial period.Initially, the theater was called Nguyen Van Hao Theater, then changed its name to Cong Nhan Theater, and is currently the Ho Chi Minh City Drama Theater.

name: Saint Nguyen Duy Khang Parish (Binh Thanh)
description: Saint Nguyen Duy Khang Parish was established in 1968, belonging to Gia Dinh Parish, Ho Chi Minh City Archdiocese.

name: Ky Dong Church
description: Ky Dong Church, officially known as Our Lady of Perpetual Help Church, is an impressive religious architectural work in District 3. Inaugurated in 1952, the church has an innovative design, not fussy but still exudes solemnity with harmonious geometric blocks.

name: Monastery of Saint Paul
description: St. Paul of Chartres Monastery in Saigon is the first nuns' monastery in Vietnam, built in 1862. This project was designed by architect Nguyen Truong To, with French architectural style combined with Vietnamese culture.

name: Ho Chi Minh City University of Agriculture and Forestry
description: Ho Chi Minh City University of Agriculture and Forestry (NLU) is a multi-disciplinary, multi-field university, specializing in training in agriculture, forestry, fisheries, economics, technology and environment.

name: Thi Nghe Parish
description: Thi Nghe Parish, also officially known as Dominican Parish - Ba Chieu, is a Catholic parish belonging to the Archdiocese of Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Idecaf - Institute for Cultural Exchange with France
description: Established in 1982, the Institute for Cultural Exchange with France (IDECAF) is an organization with the function of teaching French, organizing cultural activities and promoting cultural and educational cooperation between Vietnam and France.

name: Thai Binh Market
description: Thai Binh Market is a long-standing traditional market, located right in the center of District 1. The market is famous for its fresh food stalls and local specialties.

name: District 5 Cultural Center
description: District 5 Cultural Center is a place to organize cultural, artistic, community educational activities and gifted classes for local people.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Tropical Diseases Hospital
description: Ho Chi Minh City Hospital for Tropical Diseases is a class I specialized hospital, specializing in the field of examination and treatment of infectious and tropical diseases and disease prevention.

name: Rex Hotel
description: Rex Hotel is a 5-star hotel with a long history, located in a prime location in the heart of District 1, opposite Nguyen Hue Walking Street.Built in 1927, the hotel stands out with its architecture imbued with Vietnamese culture combined with modern amenities.

name: Dong Khanh Hotel
description: Dong Khanh Hotel is a long-standing hotel located in the Cho Lon area (District 5), Ho Chi Minh City.The hotel has architecture imbued with Vietnamese-Chinese culture.

name: Cho Ray Hospital
description: Cho Ray Hospital is one of the largest and oldest tertiary hospitals in Ho Chi Minh City, established in 1900.

name: Palace Saigon Hotel
description: Palace Hotel Saigon is a 4-star hotel located in a prime location right on Nguyen Hue walking street, center of District 1.

name: Caravelle Saigon Hotel
description: Caravelle Hotel is an iconic 5-star hotel in the heart of District 1. The hotel is famous for its ancient French architecture built in 1959.

name: Thu Duc Water Factory
description: Thu Duc Water Plant is a production unit under Saigon Water Supply Corporation (SAWACO), playing an important role in providing clean water to Ho Chi Minh City.The factory is not open to general visitors but is only open to pre-registered groups.

name: Phat Diem Parish
description: Phat Diem Parish belongs to the Archdiocese of Ho Chi Minh City, located in Phu Nhuan district.

name: Children's House District 3
description: District 3 Children's House is an activity center for children and teenagers in District 3, Ho Chi Minh City.This place organizes many gifted classes (martial arts, music, fine arts, foreign languages...), entertainment activities, and corporate events to comprehensively develop children.

name: District 5 Post Office
description: District 5 Central Post Office, also known as Cho Lon Post Office, is one of the major post offices of Vietnam Post in Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Ho Chi Minh City University of Architecture
description: Ho Chi Minh City University of Architecture (UAH) is one of the leading training institutions in Vietnam in the fields of architecture, construction, design and planning.The school has a long history, established in 1926 and affiliated with the Ministry of Construction.

name: Chi Hoa Examination
description: Chi Hoa Prison (or Chi Hoa Detention Camp) is a famous prison in Ho Chi Minh City, built by the French in 1943. This place is known for its unique square octagonal architecture (feng shui bagua) and was once known as "no escape".

name: Phu Tho Central Post Office
description: Phu Tho Central Post Office is a branch of Vietnam Post Corporation, specializing in providing postal services, delivery, and other services.

name: Majestic Saigon Hotel
description: This is an iconic 5-star hotel in the center of District 1, Ho Chi Minh City.The hotel is famous for its ancient French architecture, built in 1925, located in a prime location at the corner of Dong Khoi and Ton Duc Thang streets, overlooking the Saigon River.

name: Tu Du Hospital
description: Tu Du Hospital is a leading obstetrics and gynecology hospital in Vietnam.The hospital provides medical examination and treatment services, reproductive health care, maternity, and reproductive support for women.

name: Saigon General Hospital
description: Saigon General Hospital is a long-standing medical facility in Ho Chi Minh City, with a history of formation and development of more than 100 years.In October 2025, the People's Committee of Ho Chi Minh City issued a decision to merge this hospital into Gia Dinh People's Hospital, and the hospital will officially stop operating under its current name from January 1, 2026.

name: Phung Son Pagoda
description: Phung Son Ancestral Temple, also known as Go Pagoda, is an ancient pagoda with a history of more than 200 years old.The pagoda was built on a high mound in the ancient Gia Dinh area.The temple has traditional Southern Buddhist architecture.

name: Ho Chi Minh City People's Committee
description: Ho Chi Minh City People's Committee Headquarters is one of the most prominent and long-standing architectural works in the city, built in 1908 and also known as Saigon City Hall.

name: Pham Ngoc Thach Hospital
description: Pham Ngoc Thach Hospital is a leading specialized hospital in Tuberculosis and Lung Disease, located in District 5, Ho Chi Minh City.

name: Department of Industry and Trade, Department of Information and Communications of Ho Chi Minh City
description:
The Department of Industry and Trade of Ho Chi Minh City is a specialized agency under the People's Committee of Ho Chi Minh City, with the function of state management of industrial and commercial fields in the city.
Ho Chi Minh City Department of Information and Communications is a specialized agency under Ho Chi Minh City People's Committee, with the function of state management of information, communications, information technology, postal, telecommunications, and network information security in the area.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Stock Exchange
description:
Ho Chi Minh City Stock Exchange (HOSE) is headquartered at 16 Vo Van Kiet Street, Nguyen Thai Binh Ward, District 1.
